comm: decent pace, outside off, and squirted to point off a fat outside edge. Decent start
decent area once again as de Kock rocks back into the crease to flick his first single through the leg side

lovely timing! Really not a lot wrong with that delivery, full, tight, a hint of swing back into the left-hander. But Rossouw's timing picks up where it left off at Centurion. Whistles through midwicket
the outfield is lightning quick as this one is punched from under the eyeline into the covers
forward and defended to mid-off
up onto the toes, defended back down the pitch. Not a bad maiden over. But it's not a maiden over. If you see what I did there
good delivery, shaping from leg to off on a good line and length. Defended
on the pads, flicked hard to the sweeper behind square
spanked! That was an over-pitched outswinging half-volley, and Rossouw drills it with a big stride, an elegant knee-bend and a whoomph of bat
good riposte! A genuine lifter from a full, tight length. Takes a fat edge and eludes Smith, diving to his left at a solitary slip
lifting off a good length again, and defended with one hand
calmly defended into the off-side, where a misfield gifts an extra single. Whoops. The outfield didn't help there, to be fair
short and wide, I'm afraid that's rubbish in any format. Rossouw frees his hands and flings an uppercut four over backward point

better line and length, but that's some lovely timing through the covers, and the outfield is so quick it's as if the ball has been given an armed escort to the boundary as the fielder sprints to stay level with it
hauled into the leg side, the pressure's on for the debutants
round the wicket, and that's a fine delivery. Kicks off the turf and beats the outside edge
a crunching cut into the off side but can't pierce the infield this time
on the back foot, drilled hard into the covers
onto the front foot, pushed to the off side
poor delivery once again, curling into the pads which is never a good idea against de Kock. Fierce timing through the leg side but a fine diving stop to save the four
defended into the off side
forward to defend back down the track
lovely strike, full face, pummelled down the ground
on the pads again, whipped hard through midwicket and an instant call of two. South Africa are cooking
tight line, lifting off the deck, defended to the off side
power, placement and not even the pretence of a jog down the track, That was four from the moment it was flogged dismissively on the up through the covers
tighter to off stump and a bit of nibble off the pitch. Well bowled
well bowled again, round the wicket and on that perfect length that is never quite there to drive or defend. Nips through the gate but past the stumps
tremendous ball-striking, just a fraction too full and met with a lashing blade, hitting straight through the line, working against the inswing to pound it through the covers
another decent comeback but beats the edge to no avail
punched on the up through point
left well, almost a Test-match moment there. Line and length from the bowler, and respect from the batsman
full and probing, right in the blockhole
this is turning into a good over, another tight and attacking delivery, good length and curling towards the off stump
forward and defended into the off side
defended into the off side
fully forward and well stopped in the followthrough
round the wicket, punched on the up to cover
speared in towards the toes, defended from deep in the crease
high elbow action as Rossouw attempts to drive a full-length ball straight back past the bowler. Mid-on tidies up
settling well into this over now, wider on the crease from round the wicket and defended to the off side
fuller and drilled hard back down the track, where the non-striker's stumps act as a 12th fielder
angled defence into the off side
width, and flashed through third man
crunched on the up through the covers once again. That has been a bread-and-butter stroke for Rossouw in the past 48 hours
tighter line, solid defence
patted out to cover
good bowling once again, no width to work with, as the bowler fields in his followthrough
undercut out to point, the shot was on but the execution was lacking for a change
that's impeccable. Just a fraction short, and slammed on the up through the covers once again. The timing is sensational
too much width, and Rossouw flings the sink at it, outside off. Takes a fat flying edge and fizzes over the cordon through third man
that's better, tighter line and length, and defended
opens the face, and attempts a glide through third man. But point pounces
round the wicket, angling in, defended to the leg side
clipped off the straight and narrow, out to the leg side
stunning placement through the covers once again. Just dobbed on a spankable length outside off, no lateral movement on offer, save that of a thumping piece of willow swinging through the line
nudged into the leg side
too much width, but it works in the circumstances, as de Kock doesn't quite read the slower ball. Deep point gathers
full and dabbed into the leg side
outside off, lifting through to the keeper with some extra zip. That's a good finish
dabbed into the off side and more sharp running
outside off, driven on the up through the covers
another dabbed single behind square on the off side
a bit of an inside edge on this one as Hastings probes a tight line
too much width but Warner at point is on hand to intercept a lashing cut. Lucky let-off
a big heave down the ground, it looks elegant enough, but he's not middled it at all! Right off the toe, a gentle back-pedal at mid-on, and Australia have the breakthrough!
tight defence on off stump
extra bounce, defended with the bottom hand coming loose from the handle

driven into the covers, du Plessis scampers the single into the covers, and wears the shy from Aaron Finch on his wrist as he makes his ground! He looks seriously discomforted by that ... he put his hand up to defend himself as the throw came in, and was struck flush on the thumb. Ouch
patted into the covers as Marsh finds some extra bounce
round the wicket, probing line and length, Rossouw tightens up in defence
that's a good finish to the over. Tight angled delivery into the left-hander, forcing a respectful defensive prod from a very well-set batsman
lifting into the splice and deflected to the leg side
defended into the off side, more constrictive work from round the wicket
thrashed out to deep point, and that is Rossouw's fifty, his second in as many matches!
blocked back down the wicket
back of a length, defended into the off side, as Australia begin to settle into a strong spell of seam bowling
outside off, a hint of movement off the deck to disrupt a firm drive into the covers
solidly forward, defended back down the track
nudged into the leg side from an instant call, Marsh reacts quickly in his followthrough but du Plessis was on his toes and makes it home easily enough
attempted yorker, decently executed. Another valuable dot-ball as du Plessis digs it out
defended into the off side, more tight bowling
there we go, the dam finally breaks as this one offers up just a hint too much width, and du Plessis pushes with an open face through third man
angled into the off side, no way through there
round the wicket, defended out to cover
down the track, a bit of ambition in that footwork, as the ball is filleted down to third man. Think he's bored of being hemmed in
chopped into the off side, not a lot of finesse, but finds enough of a gap to steal the single
outside off, du Plessis hops across his stumps to drive into the covers
fetch that! Du Plessis uses his feet this time, trusting the surface and exploiting the field. Into position early and a flog through the line, over extra cover
flashed hard out to point
tight line, defended into the off side
walks down the track and across the stumps to create a low full toss, wafted round the corner
blocked out to the covers
fenced into the leg side
cut hard into the off side, and another scampered single
too full, but well played from du Plessis, bissecting the two men behind square with a whistling clip! Top shot
tosses one up from over the wicket, Rossouw leans out and defends, like a dog sniffing a nettle
drags this one down a bit, the batsman rocks back and swats a pull through square leg
pushed through outside the line of off, du Plessis sits in the crease and steers through point
floated up on the stumps, comes forward, drives one more to long-on
not much sign of turn, skids on outside off, poked through cover point
drops short again, Rossouw wheels through another pulled single to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, 120kph and dabbed through backward point for one
banged in short and du Plessis cracks a pull into the deep, straight to the boundary rider
comes across and prods into the covers
dug in short, that's risen too much for the umpires' liking
full outside off, maybe a cross-seamer? Skips through a bit low as Rossouw flays unsuccessfully

one the walk, tucks the ball down into the on side, Rossouw is looking for one but the ball goes straight to Marsh... who misfields it, with the stumps unguarded! Could have been a real chance, that. Not sure where Rossouw was going
pitched up, 126kph and punched into the covers
flighted, comes forward on middle and works to mid-on, well stopped on the dive
tossed up and this time du Plessis gets it down to long-on for one
pushed through quicker, Rossouw pushes back past the bowler again
tossed up and worked off the pads through square leg
flat, skidding on as Rossouw drops back, mistimes a pull into the ground and Zampa fields
sliding across the lefty, no turn and he slices into a gap at deep backward point for two
shortish and flicked behind square on the leg side
pitched up outside off, Rossouw flannels it through the covers to the sweeper
fullish, presses forward on off, tapped away
smashed, high over extra cover, plopping just short of the rope... No mercy for Mennie, as du Plessis dances out and tangos an aerial drive with major hangtime
slower ball, comes across and dinks into a gap
waits in the crease and angles the ball towards backward point - not too much damage for the Menster in the end
floated up outside off, pushed into the covers on the front foot
gives it some air, du Plessis gets into line and taps away in front of square
touch too full from Zampa and du Plessis spanks him over extra cover, goes inside out again, really well timed because he wasn't quite to the pitch, powerful wristwork
slightly short this time, again not a bad ball but du Plessis flashes a cut behind deep point, beats the man to the rope, four more!
tossed up on middle and leg, worked back down the track
gets on to the front foot and pushes one into the covers to finish an expensive over
pitched up and driven off the toes fine of mid-on
short ball, Rossouw is seeing it well, rocks into position and bludgeons a flat pull straight to the man at deep square leg for just a single
back over the wicket, dug in short, turned to leg but they think better of running
slightly back of a length, stays on the back foot and punches to the cover sweeper

woof, that's an umpire killer! Pitched up, 134kph and it disappears back a few clicks quicker, I'd wager, hammered through the line and Nigel Llong throws himself overboard as Mennie glances back to see the ball thump into the boards
on the body, nudged through the leg side and into a gap for two
floated up, slow and loopy, driven through the off side
pushed across the left-hander, he comes foward and steers through the covers for one more
slows it down again, tapped away towards cover
pick that out, another off-side thump from Faf, gets a stride in and clubs over cover for four more
shuffles out and dinks a drive back down the ground to long-on
tossed up on the stumps, works across the line to midwicket
length ball, 138kph around off, turned to the leg side and they abort on the single
slightly wider line, Faf drops back and glides a single to third man
uses the feet again, not quite to the pitch and the bat turns in the hands as Rossouw drives, bobbles along the carpet to mid-off on the edge of the ring
full and straight, 139kph and flicked neatly off the toes through square leg
round the wicket, pitched up and clipped down the ground to long-on

more tap for the new boys, a stiff-armed jab down the ground, du Plessis strolling out and crunching a straight drive through the line, Stevie Smith gives valiant chase and goes barreling into the rope but can't prevent a boundary

shortish and Rossouw pulls, sends it swirling into the Joburg atmosphere - taken at deep square leg! Not the most calculated of risks, looked like a long boundary out that direction and it was well short of carrying, Hastings again the bowler to strike. Looks like it was a cross-seamer that did for Rossouw... and a bit of a lucky take from Worrall, the sub fielder, as it went through the hands but landed in his lap
the batsmen crossed, Faf pushes into a gap at cover for one
round the wicket, good length on off and defended coming forwards
comes across on off and blocks
bouncer, welcome to the jungle, 133kph but trampolining through... too high
another short ball, outside off and JP gets into line this time
good length outside the line of off, Duminy settles for seeing off the over and prods into the covers
full and straight, du Plessis whips firmly to leg, won't quite beat the man in the deep - but two more brings up a half-century for the SA captain, who's going nicely
angled in with the arm, nudged off the legs for one more
over the wicket to the left-hander, pitched up and driven through the covers to get going
zoinks, that did something! Only 128kph from Tremain but the seam was rotating and it leapt off a length, past the shoulder of the bat as du Plessis' eyes widened
goes for the yorker, not quite where he wanted it and du Plessis drills it back down the ground, beats two fielders to the long-on rope
fullish and in the channel this time, reaches for the swipe and the ball flies aerially through backward point
stops in the pitch a fraction, through the drive early but it loops wide of Hastings in his follow through and runs to long-off
comes across on off and blocks a length ball
dug in, 130 kays, flying through above the ducking Duminy (not a euphemism)
touch back of a length outside off, dropped into the covers and fielded quickly
length, angled in from round the wicket, Duminy closes the face and flicks one through backward square leg
goes back and across outside off, opens the face and glides one more to third man
dobbed on the pads, du Plessis flicks it through square, there's a man coming in off the boundary but they make it back for a second easily enough
full and floaty wide of the stumps, a gimme for the set batsman and he booms the half-volley through cover point for four
darted in flatter on the stumps, gets a leading edge looking to turn to leg
goes round the wicket, tossed up outside off, maybe some turn there as du Plessis plays and misses
gets this one away off his pads for a single
floated up in the channel outside off, Duminy steps out and drives through point
short ball, goes for the hook this time... top-edged to fine leg for four! Duminy not in control but he'll take the runs
comes across and pushes into the covers
good length in the channel and again Duminy pushes it cautiously away
pitched up a little further, uses the feet and steers a drive out to deep point
pitched up outside off, check-drive from du Plessis, bounces through mid-off
short at the body, paddled around the corner on the back foot, that'll be a couple to fine leg
lobbed up on middle and off, clumped through mid-off on the move
tossed up and chipped over the off side, won't quite carry all the way to deep extra cover running in
quick and flat and pushed away into the covers
big turn... but unfortunately for Australia it has turned well down the leg side and run for extras. Maybe hit a crack?
floated up on the stumps and worked through midwicket for a single
flighted, definitely some turn for Head this time, takes the outside edge as Duminy pushes at it, but he got enough on the ball to send it wide of Wade's gloves and running fine for four more
tossed up and clipped to leg for another single
floated up on the stumps, plays with the turn towards midwicket, Smith cleans up
pushed across, stays in the crease and prods to extra cover
outside off and Duminy opens the face to slide a single through backward point
bit slower, outside the line of off, dabbed into the covers
on the stumps, waits for it and flicks down the ground to long-on
pushed through a bit quicker on off stump and du Plessis defends this time
round the wicket, shortish outside off, lets it go
full and now Duminy unleashes, skipping forwards and lofting over mid-off, clears the fielder and picks up four - that's the 50 stand between these two, a tidy partnership
draws his length back a touch, comes across and dabs behind square
good length in the channel, du Plessis opens the face to third man
pitched up, 128kph in the slot, doesn't quite catch the drive and sends it to backward point
full outside off and this time Duminy gets a push in front of square to the sweeper
tossed up and poked back past the bowler to long-on
flighted, comes forward and pushes to mid-off
full outside off, steers this one through the covers for one
very full, on the toes and thumped back low past the bowler's outstretched hand, just a single to long-on
gives it some air... and du Plessis gives it some tap, opening up the body and thrashing a drive through the covers, beats the fielder on the fence!
pushed through, nurdled to leg and they scamper one as the fielder homes in
outside off, nurdled backward of point
round the wicket, banged in short, and hoicked into the leg side with a downward thump of the bat
very full, targetting the stumps and drilled firmly up to long-off, very straight ball-striking, nearly flicks the non-strikers' stumps
on the hip and dabbed round the corner
full and straight again, tapped to mid-on for another sharp single
too short, and the bounce is too true. Battered in front of square with a rifle-crack of willow
solidly onto the front foot, back foot anchored in the event of spin
chipped over the top of the bowler, and bounces away down to long-off
nudged into the off side
patted to leg, and they take the single
outside off, gave himself room with a shimmy to leg, and freed the hands with a sweet flowing drive over the covers. Opened the face and gave it some humpty
clobbered into the deep where Warner does well to gather and release in double-quick time
no cutting that one off! Width outside off, and walloped high and handsome over the cover field. South Africa are putting the hammer down
tighter line, patted into the covers
tight line on off stump from round the wicket. Defended
outside off, dabbed into the covers, good response to that early-over flogging
nudged into the leg side
works the gap to keep the strike
very straight, full face of the bat, worked down to long-off
on the pads, hustled square
too short this time, but the ball slides on as du Plessis doesn't quite time his pull
dragged down this time as well, but there's no recourse this time. Du Plessis rocks back, slams a flat pull and that's four more through wide long-on
tossed up, du Plessis advances to make himself a full toss but the bowler cuts it off well
outside off, chopped out to point
sliding down the leg side, looked like an attempted variation gone wrong
solidly forward and defended out to point
lifting off the seam and strikes the back pad
good change up in pace, Duminy is beaten
spang! Full length, full stride, too wide, and flogged high over wide long-off
whoops, another attempted change of gear, but that goes awry
flicked to the leg side for another single
tighter line, lifts off the seam, fenced to third man
tip and run into the off side
short and pulled out through deep backward square leg
patted into the covers
tight line, full length, du Plessis jabs a single to cover and takes off for a tight run
heave ho, Duminy eyes up the midwicket boundary but can't lay a bat on his drag across the line
swift feet, galloping down the track, driven to long-off
banged in short, and Duminy lines up an uppercut but thinks better of it
attempted whip across the line
he connects with this one alright! Flogged through the leg side to move to 99!
outside off, up on the toes, panned into the covers, and out comes the punch of the glove immediately. His sixth ODI hundred, and his third against Australia. Cracking innings!
up on the toes, drilled down to long-off
outside off, a big heave across the line once more from Duminy. He wants that elusive six, but still none forthcoming in this innings
on the pads, nudged to leg
there it is! Duminy has been eyeing up the midwicket boundary for several overs, and finally he gets one in the slot, a low full-toss, pounded high into the stratosphere and onto the grassy bank!
shorter ball, slower ball, good riposte, Duminy can't make contact
in the slot, on the toes and too full to go anywhere but out of the ground! Another mighty spank into the stands at midwicket!
hustles across the crease to work a single to square leg
a high and wide full toss, not a bad ball in the circumstances as deep cover cleans up
spannered out to deep midwicket, looked and sounded like a six straight off the middle, but somehow plugs short of cow corner and the fielder tidies up
full length, poked into the covers
full and horrid, baseball-bowling, in the slot for a home run over cow corner. That is terrible bowling and great opportunistic batting
hangs back in the crease, anticipating Marsh's determination to find a length, any length, and that is monstered on the up through the covers! Fierce batting!
width again, another wipe of the bat, and a fizzing edge eludes the diving Wade behind the stumps! This is getting messy now
finally, the breakthrough! Marsh serves up the offcutter and Duminy, on the charge, chops onto his stumps! He died by his own sword there, but it was thrilling acceleration while it lasted
wafted into the leg side
sliding down leg, that's a bit unfortunate as the batsman was shaping towards the off side
worked around the corner with a controlled pull to get off the mark
drilled on the up to deep point
short again, Miller leans inside the line to pull another single round the corner
banged in too short once again, and Miller has had several sighters on that length. This time he nails it behind square with a roll of the wrists
another short ball, Miller is through the shot too soon this time
a perfectly placed leading edge into no-man's land at midwicket! Two men converge but neither gets close as they scamper back for two
nailed out to cow corner, but Smith is well placed and du Plessis has picked out the man, five metres in from the rope! The skipper departs as Australia regain a toe-hold in the final overs
solidly into line
up on the toes and tapped back to the bowler
outside off, and panned out to deep cover to get off the mark
yorker. Well directed. That's a fine over from Marsh
sharp delivery in Hastings' return to the fray, through to the keeper
full length, an inside-out drive to midwicket
good delivery, a wide yorker that Miller can only toe-end back to the bowler
wide again but he misses his length this time. Just a half-volley and Miller wallops it all along the ground to the cover fence
low full toss, pumped down to long-off
tapped to cover
clipped in the air, into the leg side
opens the face, glides a single down to deep point
Farhaan wanders across his stumps, clips very fine, but short backward square should have done better to haul that in...
crunched firmly into the covers, nailed it, but mid-off does well
outside off, a swish across the line, but it's the slower ball and Miller can't connect
firm drive down the ground
working the singles, but the big shots remain a touch elusive...
that's the one! Miller finds his range with a fierce drill through the covers
driven hard to long-off
driven hard again, but still South Africa's grandest intentions are kept under wraps
slower-ball bouncer, very wide, toe-ended out to cover with a waft of the bat
spanked in the air, but not enough distance or power. Just the single. Australia are brawling hard in these final overs

heaved hard and violently out to deep midwicket! Tremain has his maiden ODI wicket, and it's come at a vital moment! Got right under the shot and gave Warner several decades to contemplate the ball as it fell back to earth. But he judged it just fine and South Africa's charge still hasn't quite materialised
on the toes, flicked firmly to deep midwicket
slower ball bouncer, Parnell leans back to glide a cut down to third man, where the ball bobbles on the rough outfield but safely into the hands of the fielder
that's the one they've been waiting for! A full wind-up as Tremain drops short, and Parnell climbs across the line with a firm pull in front of square
onto the front foot, and punched down to long-off
wide of off stump, clubbed out to deep extra cover
whoops, a low full-toss outside off, that's asking for trouble. Miller wallops it for a one-bounce four through wide long-on

chopped hard out to point, and a tumbling stop ... in fact, it's a catch! Zampa reacted so calmly that no-one really noticed it was out. The umpires are taking a look, and lo and behold, the ball buried in his breadbasket! Time is called on Miller Time...
banged in short, and an ambitious roundhouse swipe, no contact but plenty intent
outside off, dabbed out to point
outside off, tapped into the gap
on the pads, worked square for another single. Lucky's first run for South Africa!
pounded down the ground for a three-bounce four through long-off! Cleared the front leg to batter a length delivery
stunning followthrough, reminiscent of Darren Gough's backside-slapping strokeplay at Sydney in 1994-95, but no contact this time
he has absolutely battered this one! In the slot, and picks the slower ball as well. Timing, power, placement. Into the stands over the bowler's head!
another murderous wipe through the line, but connects with nothing but air! I have hit upon a new favourite tailend batsman...
short and wide, if he'd left it he'd have had another go at it, for sure. But instead he toe-ended it down to deep point
slower ball, well disguised, through to the keeper
that's a ripper to start with, leaping like an electrocuted trout off a length, Finch looked startled as he dropped the hands and the ball boomed into the keeper's gloves
fullish, tight line of off stump, gets bat on it this time and blocks to cover
draws him forward, reaching for the ball away from his body as it seams a fraction, keeps it down in front of point and an diving stop keeps them to one
oof, takes this in the midriff, at 144kph, too! Slightly short and David Warner's first ball has him hopping around the crease
pitched up and pushed a little wide, steered through backward point from the crease
cripes, another jaffa to finish with, fired in and then zipping away off a length, this close to Finch's outside edge
angled across and dabbed down behind square on the off side

short ball, Finch scoops it straight up - bagged by Behardien at square leg! Done for pace, I suspect, looking to get on with it, as he had to, but the stroke was all sorts of wrong, hoicked up like a white flag and South Africa have their first
beats the outside edge, that's a snorting ball, too. Warner hung bat and swished, so close to nicking off

Rabada's burning rubber with these wheels, 146kph and hitting the pads, possibly too high and the ball flies to slip... whose throw is then tipped past midwicket by Rabada in his follow through, gifting a single
unplayable! That went straight through Smith as he tried to defend on off stump, just did enough off the deck at a sizzling speed
angled in and holding its line, 144kph and past the outside edge again. This is going to be quite a test
dug in short and Warner tries to tuck to leg, bottom-edges just past his stumps, I think
pace and bounce, rolls his fingers over it and sends a 142kph delivery jagging away past the outside edge
banged in short and this time Warner is in control of the pull down to fine leg
that's a corking shot to get off the mark with, 139kph outside off, maybe a fraction short and Smith fillets it through cover
two in a row! Smith squints and picks up the gauntlet, using the pace again to fire a 142kph delivery between cover and point
straighter line from Steyn, shuffles across and works one to square leg
back of a length, good pace again but calmly worked off the body for one
lashed through point, Warner capitalises on a bit of width and dishes out some treatment to Rabada in kind
good length on the stumps, Warner pushes it back towards mid-on
flying through in the channel outside off, left alone
tucking him up at 143kph, Warner hops back and turns down into the leg side
dug in short, climbing through above Warner... called on height
fires to ball in full, serious heat at 148kph and Warner has to jam his bat down on it
touch short outside off and Smith leaps into line and effects a gunslinger's pose as he attempt to flay another square drive but picks out the fielder
length ball, tighter to the stumps and blocked into the covers
takes the pace off this, sits up outside off and stunned behind backward point moving across
goes back and works a straighter delivery through the leg side
back of a length over middle and leg, Warner chops down on it
touch short, 138kph on the body, spits at Warner and he again is concerned only with defusing the threat
fired in full and flicked through backward square leg
shortish and angled across on off, Warner jabs it away
back of a length, slightly wider and inviting the cut, only manages a bottom edge through to the keeper on the bounce
banged in but down the leg side
Rabada puts it on a length, middle and leg stump at 142kph, worked towards mid-on
the change-up works this time, an offcutter deceives Warner, who inside-edges on to his body
short ball, looked to have hurried him... but Warner still manages to bludgeon it through midwicket for four, pulled off the splice of the bat but it outruns the fielder

fired down leg, thick inside edge... WHADDACATCH!!! Steyn gets Smith, though he has de Kock to thank, he flew to his left to hold the chance one-handed, before tumbling and rising in delight to be mobbed by his team-mates. Smiffy's gotta go, via to a worldie from Quinny; the only thing that perhaps helped was that Steyn bowled it so far down leg he knew where he had to start moving early
welcomes the new man with a bumper, Bailey bails out early... too high
slightly back of a length, tapped down into the off side
good shape on this, 132kph and fading away as Bailey plays inside the line
angled in straighter, menacing the stumps as Bailey hangs back, blunts it into the off side
nasty, rising ball, 138kph at the ribs, fended away behind square for Bailey's first run
dug in short and Warner hits back with a left cross, swung hard up over midwicket and it races away in front of square for four
pitched up outside off, Bailey stands and clunks a cut-cum-drive off the toe of the bat
better line, Bailey's turned around on off stump, takes the edge but fails short
shorter, rising up at 140kph and fended away in front of the stumps
quicker still, 143kph and Bailey can't do anything with it back in the crease
fullish, outside off, reaches for the drive and inside-edges to leg
ach, he's got that wrong, a slower ball comes out as a full toss and Bailey bludges it gratefully through the covers for a first boundary
there's Warner with the bit between his teeth again, steps out and laces a precision drive between extra cover and mid-off, four more, please
shortish and turned off the body to leg
Steyn digs this in and Warner plays a pull, rolling the wrists out to deep square leg
minor victory for the bowler, finding the outside edge... but Bailey plays it well, soft hands and opening the face to send it fine of third man
Steyn's dander is up after that, hammers the pitch halfway down, 137kph and defended from the crease
beats the bat to finish the over, a fizzing legbreak from slightly back of a length, Bailey whistles in the wind from deep in the crease
short and slightly leg side, Warner flicks and misses

stand and deliver, crashed through the covers, though Rossouw nearly pulls off a screamer diving to his right! It was in the air was quite a way, between two fielders and then skittering away to the rope - that's the 50 up
on the stumps and pushed into the off side
shortish and this beats Warner on the inside, maybe clips the edge before thudding into the pads
back of a length, pushed across and Warner comes forward to block

pinned in front, that stayed low... but umpire Llong walks away! After some deliberation, SA ask for the review. They desperately want to get rid of Warner, but this won't be the ball, as it pitched well outside leg stump. Looked like it would have been fuller, given the height at which it went through
length ball outside off, 144kph and punched on the up into the covers
over the wicket, banged in and Warner whirls around the crump a pull to deep backward square
goes round the wicket, angled in at 135kph and hitting the pad, possible via an inside edge
shortish and defended on the stumps
keeps bringing the ball back in on the angle, Bailey works to leg
shortish, over off stump, Bailey flaps it down in front of square

bowled him, off stump pegged back! The pressure was building on Bailey and he went for the big shot, aiming down the ground but it wasn't quite there, seamed a fraction and he played around it as Parnell hit the bull's eye. Parnell then starts dabbing in celebration... that or he's short-circuiting
short ball, worked off the hips for a single
back of a length on off stump, poked into the covers
doesn't take long for Marsh to open up, offered a modicum of width and he mows a drive through backward point to get off the mark with a boundary
oh, that's even better, too full from Phehlukwayo and Marsh pings a supremely timed drive back past mid-on
pitched up, steps into the drive but this time finds mid-on
back of a length, 132kph and blocked on off stump
short and pushed across outside off, Warner swats through cover point
goes round the wicket to the right-hander again, worked away off the pads
outside off, decent line and Warner stays back to run one to third man
dug in at 138kph from round the wicket, tucked to the leg side
back of a length once again, tapped down towards point

Parnell has found his groove, this flies through at 137kph as Marsh shoudlers arms - now they're not swinging (which is probably wise as Australia need some watchfully rapid consolidation. If that makes any sense)
spiders in and puts the ball on a length, not much turn and Warner drops back to glides the ball to the third-man fence
floated up outside off, Warner comes forward and punches through mid-off
flighted, spinning away on off stump, Marsh defends
there's the wrong'un, coming back in as the batsman chops to midwicket
tossed up outside the line of off, leans into a prod to cover
pushed through a bit quicker, Marsh stays back and jabs to the left of extra cover, could have been tight if the pick up was clean
dug in, slightly leg side and Marsh gets some glove on the pull, sends it wide of de Kock and that'll be four
oh, you jammy devil! Marsh gets four more, this time via the inside edge as he propped forwards, can't have been far from taking leg stump
good length on off, 136kph and Marsh blocks this one securely
pitched up, invites the drive, gets a thick edge through backward square leg
over the wicket, prods forward and gets an inside edge
slightly short, on the hips and worked around the corner for one - maybe off the padding
floats the ball up outside the line of off, Warner reaches to slap through the covers
goes straighter, full and flighted and bunted down the ground
angled across the southpaw, who sits back and tickles towards short third man
pushed through on the stumps, Warner presses out to block
Warner drops back, think this was the Bosie and he plays it very late, gets it past the fielder for a couple
tossed up outside off, angles the bat on the back foot but backward point stops this
... like I was saying ... down the leg side, bouncing alarming and catching the glove, and de Kock shuffles to his left to pouch the opportunity!
zinger! Outside off, exploding off the deck, and drawing a rather startled jab from the new batsman. Pace and bounce, all the attributes
this one explodes as well, real zip off the deck as Head lines up a cut but finds himself cramped for room and struck right on the top of his handle!
fiery work again as Parnell whistles another one through to the keeper, a touch of movement away from the left-hander
that's the way to do it! If there's lift in the deck, get underneath it and lash it high over third man for six!
nurdled off the hip to keep the runs ticking in a very lively over!
onto the front foot and flicked to the leg side
forward and blocked into the off side
drilled down the ground to long-off
driven into the covers, just finding his range
flogged through the off side but with mid-off up in the ring, there are no freebies on offer
worked off the pad to backward square. Tidy work
tapped into the off side
firmly drilled off the back foot, but that's some sure-footed fielding from Imran Tahir at third man, cutting off a whistling stroke and tumbling to keep it in play
tight defence on the back foot
lashed down to backward point, and once again a forceful stroke is under-rewarded. Still, the hundred is up
wicket to wicket, tapped to point
outside off and that's another hooter-seeking delivery, just bursting off the turf past a startled edge. Lively!
on the pads, tucked square for another single
outside off, crashing back-cut but straight to the man at backward point
opens the face in a attempted glide, but can't find the angle
full length, pushing Warner right back onto his stumps. Tidy work

a bit of width and this time Warner finds the gap in the covers, and the boundary too, as the man in the deep makes an utter horlicks of the attempted gather, lets it through his feet and onto the rope!

panned high and hard into the stands! Warner isn't giving up the chase just yet! Shorter this time, and climbed alarmingly off the seam, but he was on the back foot and ready to give it everything. Shot. And suddenly a fine over goes for four, six!
round the wicket, good areas, pushed back to the bowler
poked out to point
on the pads, clipped square, and there is Warner's fifty! Well batted, he is keeping his side afloat ...
crunched through the covers, picks the gap well

short and slammed to short midwicket, and that is the end of Warner! Duminy's golden arm strikes, it was dragged down and could have been dispatched to any corner of the Highveld. Instead, he finds Miller's bucket hands, and that is probably curtains for Australia's hopes!
down on one knee, looking to paddle the ball fine, but can't find the angle
full-faced drive but a half-stop in the followthrough
tapped to the off side for a sharp single
solidly onto the front foot, and poked to cover
tries a flick to leg, but can't connect
sweetly drilled on the up into the covers. But the outfield is very bumpy as Rababa is nutmegged by a late change of direction, a long chase to save his blushes
an offcutter to finish, tidy work
onto the front foot, pushed to the off side
forward and defended
flicked into the leg side
chipped out to the deep
tossed up and driven on the front foot to extra cover
Lucky pushes the ball across Wade's bows, he steers to third man
goes back and opens the face down to third man for one more
tighter to the stumps, good-length ball and blocked back to the bowler
drilled out to deep cover
back of a length, defended to the off side
slashed high and hard through third man. Every little helps!
down on one knee, and slashed fiercely through backward square
crunched into the covers
in the air for a moment or two but no-one on hand in the covers. Another single into the deep
forward and a sharp quick single into the covers
bashed hard into the covers, that's a well placed stroke, and it races past the infield and out of the reach of the sweeper. Shot
poked into the off side. Australia keep themselves afloat with another productive over
whoosh! Like Sergio at the Ryder Cup, a broad-shouldered bash down the fairway, into the stands at long-off! (And just like Sergio, he's bound now to miss a tiddler for par)
slashed hard behind square, and so nearly a hand to that from Rossouw at backward point!
another slashing drive, out to the cover boundary
down on one knee to sweep, and well placed too
fenced down to third man
rides the bounce outside off
width and cut hard to deep point
crashed out to cover, another well played stroke
low full toss on the toes, clipped hard to the leg side
forward, onto the front foot, firmly pushed into the off side
worked down to long-on
Head keeps the score ticking with another calm push down the ground
whistling past the edge, that was rapid and in the channel. No contact
tight line and cut off a bottom edge, off the top of the stumps and underneath the diving keeper for four. Unlucky for Steyn but he might, at a pinch, accept the moral victory
full and tight again
tight line, sharp pace, defended off the back foot
too good from Steyn, a tight and uncompromising line. Head is looking for the cut, but the ball is through him every time
on the pads, worked into the leg side to keep the strike
thumped down to long-off
well nurdled there from Wade, on the pads, turning down the leg side and just helped round the corner with excellent timing
tucked to the leg side again
that's another lovely strike, pumped through backward point as Tahir dropped short with his googly
tighter line from Tahir as Wade defends
onto the front foot and stoutly blocked
a fraction short and hauled urgently into the leg side
back of a length, pushed out to cover
ooh, zippy delivery! Wade chased it, it was full and fast, and any bat would surely have flown. But the ball nipped off the deck and eluded everything
back and across, defended out to gully
outside off, dabbed into the covers
squeezed into the off side from a very full length, looking for the single but there's nothing on offer there. Another tight over
round the wicket, and Wade works the angle down to third man
on the back foot, defended to the off side
round the wicket, very full again, and point is quickly in to keep the batsman hemmed in
back of a length, nudged out to point once more. Nowhere to go for the moment as Australia sit in for the long haul
banged in short, and that's excellent opportunism as Head pulls hard in front of square to bring up his maiden ODI fifty! Well batted

rapped on the pad, that's a huge shout, and a long pause for thought for the umpire, but up goes the finger! Australia have reviewed and understandably so, this is vital. He's right across the stumps, and under the new DRS rules, this could be Umpire's Call ... indeed it is!
angled in on the stumps and Wade flicks through midwicket - or to midwicket, rather, as an excellent stop means they have to hurry through
round the wicket, slightly short of a length, slashed and slashed hard, thick edge to third man

goes for the homer, maybe not short enough to pull, comes off the splice... and Duminy pouches it on the midwicket boundary! Two in four balls for SA and that probably puts the kibosh on Australia chasing from here
Hastings on strike as they crossed, he steers one to backward point
pitched up outside off, steps into a ginger prod to cover
tip and run into the covers, could be close if du Plessis hits at the striker's end... he doesn't
banged in short, Hastings levers his big frame out of the way
pitched up, comes forward to prod into the covers
angled in on the stumps and pushed back down the track
yowzer, that's a spicy meatball, dug in at plus-140kph and Hastings fends it away from in front of his boat race, wide of slip... Think that whacked him on the finger
Mennie shuffles across as Rabada slings one down the leg side
touch full on off, 141kph and Mennie shows it a solid straight bat, they pinch one to mid-off, whose throw misses
fired in, sliding towards leg, deflects off the pad as Hastings stays back
short outside off, Hastings stabs down into the off side
pitched up and clubbed... waaaaaaaaaayyyyyy into the leg side, in fact it goes all the way, clearing the rope at wide long-on! Some beef in that hit
and again, this time a cross-batted mow down the ground! Not all that short from Parnell but Hastings rocked back and bullocked a swipe over long-on
dug out into the leg side, they come back for two
on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
banged in short to finish, Hastings limbos back and attempts a ramp over the keeper, fails to connect

...and it nearly is now, as the returning Imran Tahir slides one through Mennie's defence! Flat and quick from the leggie and it scuttles past a swish to leg, via an inside edge, to hit the top of off
on the stumps, maybe the googly, Zampa blocks into a gap and gets off strike
pushed through outside off, goes back and steers a single through point
another rapid legbreak, strikes the pads... but leg side. May have been a slider, actually, out the front of the hand, Zampa was backing away, got an inside edge as well
tossed up and prodded away cautiously
pushed through outside the line of off, steered into the covers
slower ball, nearly does for Hastings, has a hefty thwack at it and gets a top edge that loops wide of the keeper
length on off, Zampa taps into the covers
nippy bouncer, flying through above the bat as Zampa throws himself at it - he's only a little guy and that was above head height
full and slogged, Hastings gets a hold of another one and biltongs four out between long-on and deep midwicket

takes on the cutter, picks out deep midwicket! Hastings is off, a hasty swipe across the line, not as much pace on the ball for him to work with and it sails straight to the man on the fence, Australia nine down and all but done
pitched up and sliced hard towards backward point... who hurls a throw in at the non-striker's end, though Tremain hadn't gone anywhere. Zampa can't be bothered with running on the ricochet
tossed up and bunted into the covers, taken on the bounce
pushed through, comes forward and steers towards point
loopy delivery on off, Tremain punches along the ground to mid-off
goes back and across to a full delivery and squeezes it to backward point
pushed through a bit flatter, defended solidly on off stump
here comes the googly, little bit short and Tremain has time to watch it on to the bat
shortish outside off, swing and a miss from Zampa
pitched up and steered to backward point... did it carry? Not sure it did. Either way, he's not out
in the slot, out the park! Zampa gives Lucky the treatment with a fluid bosh over deep extra cover, that travelled
bowled 'im! Lucky breaks the stumps, quick and straight and Zampa played around it backing away, which means South Africa win by a whopping 142 runs with a dozen overs to spare
